poem:
### Dining in the Glow

Hunched over screens, we forget,  
soup cooling, bread untouched.  
Chatter muted by the hum  
of digital tides. Grumpy cats  
on looping reels, a new cuisine.  
Forks remain poised mid-air,  
while we feast on flickering ghosts,  
alive only in the next scroll,  
hungry for a moment unbitten.
